text: New York City subways carry more than 5
million people a day but very few of
them ever make it to the end of the line
most writers get off elsewhere to them
the last stop is just a sign on the
train but beyond the last stop there is
life sometimes even a little mystery a
monastery in Jamaica a dockside bar with
a view of manhattan in rockaway park and
the seaside community of Tottenville on
staten island where the tracks end at
the water's edge are just three examples
of what you'll find when you travel to
the end of the line
if you come out of the f train at the
